text: [MUSIC PLAYING]

Raising two daughters in
a middle income household

in India, my parents
brought me up
to be strong and competitive.

However, competing all my life
did make handling setbacks

a little more
difficult. In moments

of darkness, what really pulled
me through were two big things.

One, the incredible
love I received
from my family and friends.

Two, the small little
steps I took every day

to appreciate who I
am, be kind to myself,
and keep moving forward.

Gradually, I came to appreciate
the power of minuscules.

Taking a short walk with
my family every day,

listening to 15
minutes of a podcast,

or reading a few pages of
my favorite book at night.

Today, I don't think
about moving mountains.

The purpose of my life is
to leave every ecosystem

I'm part of as a net
positive, no matter

how small that net
positive might be.

I want to love with abandon
and let competition give way
to compassion.
[MUSIC PLAYING]
